page.title: 09Entertainment in Pennington
page.content: A great deal of the entertainment in Pennington takes place in the Memorial Hall.It is managed by two villagers and each club in the village is allowed one representative on the Memorial Hall Committee.Entertainment in the village is advertised in the Chit Chat newspaper.Twice weekly children and adults are entertained by performing Latin American dancing,old time and mordern ballroom dancing.They have learned about fifty dances. Sometimes the Morris Men come to entertain us.They provide lots of fun for the family.Every year in February the villagers perform a pantomime at the Memorial Hall.Both children and adults take part.In 1983 we did Sleeping Beauty which is about a girl who has a spell put on her at her christening.The spell is broken when she is kissed by a prince.
